channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-17532] Yarn Job execution get failed when LZ4 Compression Codec is used
item.description:
When we try to compress a file using the LZ4 codec compression type then the yarn job gets failed with the error message :

net.jpountz.lz4.LZ4Compressorcompres(Ljava/nio/ByteBuffer;Ljava/nio/ByteBuffer;)V
item.summary: Yarn Job execution get failed when LZ4 Compression Codec is used

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: this was a hadoop common issue , hence moved

-1 overall

Test Report:
can you please review the patch tasanuma /  hemanthboyina

Sorry, I'm not familiar with this topic.

 csun / viirya Could you take a look since it is introduced by HADOOP-17292?
Why remove <scope>provided</scope>? I think we intentionally make it as provided scope.
Yes, but there is another version(1.2.0)  of the same jar present and due to that, we are getting this error.

I saw lz4-java is excluded from org.apache.kafka in the patch. Does the another version come from it? Isn't it enough?

csun What do you think? I remember we wanted it to be provided scope. I don't think we should make it as compile scope now.

Does the another version come from it? ==> Yes, but anyways we need that dependency so is it better to add it as a part of a deployment.

Any specific reason for keeping provided scope?
As I said in above comment, it is intentional to have it as provided scope to avoid pull the dependency for the users not use the compression codec.

Sorry for chiming in late here. Yes I agree we should keep the dependency either provided or optional in case Hadoop users do not need it. Also, is the issue here caused by the conflicting version from Kafka? and the change on provided scope is not that related?

is the issue here caused by the conflicting version from Kafka? ==> Yes, and provided scope is not related to this issue.

I thought that it will be good to provide the dependency rather than giving an option to the user(as the user has to find the required location).

 

If we want to keep the scope as provided then I will update the patch to exclude only the lz4 1.2.0 version from the Kafka client.
csun/ viirya I have attached the *.002.patch, which contains the only exclude older version(1.2.0) of a jar from the Kafka client dependency.

-1 overall
